channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Amazon Web Services CEO Matt Garman talks about why the company lagged rivals in AI—until now
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Google’s head of Android once cold-emailed the $2 trillion tech giant’s cofounder Sergey Brin for graduate school advice—he got a job offer instead
item.description: Early in his career, Sameer Samat’s cofounders wanted to ditch their startup for college. A 3 a.m. email to Google’s cofounder Sergey Brin changed the...

item.title: Men Who Felled Sycamore Gap Tree Are Given Prison Sentences in U.K.
item.description: The tree, a beloved landmark that stood by Hadrian’s Wall in northern England, was found illegally cut down in 2023.

item.title: Stamps just got more expensive. Here’s what it will cost you to mail a letter now
item.description: Yep, postcards will cost more too.

item.title: I’m a Genocide Scholar. I Know It When I See It.
item.description: A professor of Holocaust and genocide studies comes to a painful conclusion about Israel’s actions in Gaza.

item.title: 21 Questions About the NYC Mayoral Race, Answered
item.description: Readers from around the world asked about Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani’s surprising primary win, its effect on national politics and how The Times cover...

item.title: The forecast for the U.S. economy looks cloudy as inflation rises: ‘It would be wise for the Fed to remain on the sidelines’
item.description: The effects of President Donald Trump’s tariff policy are beginning to worm their way through the economy.

item.title: Flash Floods Fill N.Y.C. Subway Station
item.description: Passengers on an uptown No. 1 train saw floodwaters swamping the station at 28th Street and Seventh Avenue in Manhattan.

item.title: Apple is pre-bunkering against China with its $500 million deal to buy American rare-earth magnets
item.description: Apple’s deal with MP Materials is more than just a supply-chain strategy. It's a geopolitical insurance policy.

item.title: Men Who Felled Sycamore Gap Tree Are Given Prison Sentences in U.K.
item.description: The tree, a beloved landmark that stood by Hadrian’s Wall in northern England, was found illegally cut down in 2023.

item.title: China Puts New Restrictions on E.V. Battery Manufacturing Technology
item.description: Beijing will now require government licenses for any effort to transfer abroad the technologies crucial for producing inexpensive electric cars.

item.title: What We Know About the U.S. Deal for a Weapons Pipeline to Ukraine
item.description: NATO allies will buy arms, then give them to Ukraine, President Trump said.

item.title: Netanyahu’s Ultra-Orthodox Allies Threaten His Coalition Government
item.description: Some of the prime minister’s political allies have quit over a proposal to make religious students serve in military, and more are threatening to do s...

item.title: Emmy Awards 2025: What to Watch For
item.description: The nominees were announced Tuesday morning at the Television Academy’s Los Angeles headquarters.

item.title: Air India Crash Findings Prompt Inspections of Boeing Fuel Switches
item.description: Airlines in India, Singapore and South Korea were inspecting fuel control switches on their Boeing jets.
